summary: Micro tools hub app featuring existing tools plus a "Text & Writing Tools" section, AdSense placements, a "Popular Tools" entry on the home page linking to a combined page, and a new "Number & Conversion Tools" card/section that opens a page containing calculators and conversion utilities (percentage, tip, split bill, age/date/time calculations, unit/currency/base conversion, random number picker).
architectural_notes: Monetization via ads: integrate Google AdSense (browser-side script) and render two ad slots (top and bottom banners) across the app or key pages.
Publish an ads.txt file at the site root for AdSense authorization; include: google.com, pub-9284074903614668, DIRECT, f08c47fec0942fa0
known_issues: Text & Writing Tools page shows only 6 tabs; missing: Lorem Ipsum Generator, Hashtag Generator, Emoji Picker/Copier.

existing_features.title: Create a Micro Tools Hub home screen that lists and navigates to these tools: QR Code Generator, Password Generator, Image Resizer, Unit Converter, and Random Name Generator.
Implement a QR Code Generator tool that allows users to enter text/URL and generate a QR code preview, with an option to download the QR code image.
Implement a Password Generator tool with configurable options (length, include uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols) and a one-click copy-to-clipboard action.
Implement an Image Resizer tool that lets users upload an image, resize by width/height (with optional aspect ratio lock), preview the result, and download the resized image.
Implement a Unit Converter tool covering common categories with two-way conversion: at minimum Length, Weight/Mass, Temperature, and Volume.
Implement a Random Name Generator tool that generates one or multiple random names with basic configuration (count and style/type), and supports copy to clipboard.

Apply a cohesive, creative visual theme across the hub and all tool pages (color palette, typography, spacing, and components) and keep it consistent throughout the app (avoid blue & purple as the primary palette).

Add the provided Google AdSense loader script to the global HTML entry point so it loads once for the entire app.

Use this exact snippet (unchanged):

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js?client=ca-pub-9284074903614668"
     crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

Add two banner ad placement areas: one near the top of the app content and one near the bottom.

- The top banner must render below the header and above the main page content.
- The bottom banner must render above the footer.
- Each banner area must be visually distinct but unobtrusive, responsive, and reserve space to minimize layout shift.
- Include minimal, user-facing placeholder labeling in English (e.g., "Advertisement") within the banner area so the placement is visible even before ad units are configured.
Update the app footer so the copyright year is generated dynamically from the user’s current date at runtime (instead of a hard-coded year), to keep the live site accurate over time.

Add a concise deployment guide for publishing the app to the Internet Computer mainnet (live), including build/deploy commands, environment/network selection, and a short post-deploy verification checklist.

Complete the existing deployment guide at frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md so it contains a full, runnable set of steps to deploy the app to the Internet Computer mainnet (live), including build/deploy commands, environment/network selection, and a short post-deploy verification checklist.

Add an ads.txt file for the deployed site, and ensure it is served at the root path `/ads.txt`. If no ads.txt currently exists, create it and include the following line exactly as provided:

google.com, pub-9284074903614668, DIRECT, f08c47fec0942fa0
Add a new hub section/card titled “Text & Writing Tools” on the main Hub page that navigates to a dedicated “Text & Writing Tools” page when selected.

Implement a new “Text & Writing Tools” page that contains the following tools (all on this page), each with an input area, an output/result area (where applicable), and a clear action/copy flow:
- Case converter (UPPER / lower / Title Case)
- Word & character counter
- Remove duplicate lines
- Text sorter (A–Z / Z–A)
- Line breaker / paragraph formatter
- Slug / URL generator
- Lorem ipsum generator
- Hashtag generator
- Emoji picker / copier

Add shared, reusable frontend utility functions to support the Text & Writing Tools transformations and ensure each tool offers a consistent “Copy to clipboard” interaction with clear success/failure feedback.
Fix the “Text & Writing Tools” page so all 9 tool tabs are visible and usable, specifically ensuring the tabs for “Lorem”, “Hashtag”, and “Emoji” appear and can be selected on all screen sizes.

Ensure the “Text & Writing Tools” tab list layout is responsive in a way that does not hide any tabs (e.g., wraps into multiple rows or becomes horizontally scrollable), while keeping all user-facing labels in English.

Update the main Hub page UI (frontend/src/pages/HubPage.tsx) so the first five individual tool cards (QR Code Generator, Password Generator, Image Resizer, Unit Converter, Random Name Generator) are no longer shown on the Hub, and are replaced by one single card titled “Popular Tools” that navigates to a new combined page when selected.

Add a new “Popular Tools” page and wire it into app navigation (frontend/src/App.tsx) so that selecting the “Popular Tools” card opens a page that contains the five tools together on a single page: QR Code Generator, Password Generator, Image Resizer, Unit Converter, and Random Name Generator.
Add a new Hub card titled “Number & Conversion Tools” on the main hub page (frontend/src/pages/HubPage.tsx) that navigates to a dedicated Number & Conversion Tools page when selected.

Wire the new “Number & Conversion Tools” page into application navigation by extending the Page union and route switch in frontend/src/App.tsx, and ensure AppLayout back navigation returns to the hub as it does for other pages.

Create a new dedicated page component for “Number & Conversion Tools” that presents all requested tools on a single page using a responsive tabbed interface (similar to frontend/src/pages/TextWritingToolsPage.tsx) with clear input/output sections, and consistent Clear/Copy interactions where applicable using the existing copy helper (frontend/src/lib/clipboard.ts).

Implement a “Percentage calculator” tool with inputs that cover common percentage operations and show results immediately: (a) “X% of Y”, (b) “What percent is X of Y”, and (c) “Percentage change from A to B”.
Implement a “Tip / gratuity calculator” tool that computes tip amount and total based on bill amount and tip percentage, with an optional split count to show per-person amounts.
Implement a “Split bill calculator” tool that splits a total amount among N people, optionally allowing an additional fee or tax percentage and showing per-person amounts.

Implement an “Age calculator” tool that accepts a date of birth and an optional “as of” date (defaulting to today) and outputs age in years (and additionally months/days breakdown if feasible within the UI).

Implement a “Date difference calculator” tool that accepts two calendar dates and outputs the difference in days (and additionally weeks/months/years breakdown if feasible), with clear handling for which date is earlier.

Implement a “Time duration calculator” tool that can compute duration between two times (with optional dates) and/or sum multiple durations, and outputs a normalized duration (e.g., hours/minutes/seconds).

Include “Unit converters” in the Number & Conversion Tools page by reusing the existing unit conversion logic (frontend/src/lib/units.ts) and providing an embedded unit converter UI similar in capability to the existing Unit Converter page.
Implement a “Binary / decimal / hex converter” tool that converts numbers between bases 2, 10, and 16, validates input based on selected base, and outputs the other representations.

Implement a “Currency converter” tool that converts between currencies without relying on external APIs by allowing the user to either (a) enter a custom exchange rate, or (b) maintain a small editable table of rates relative to a chosen base currency, then compute conversions based on those inputs.

Implement a “Random number picker” tool that generates one or more random integers within a user-defined inclusive range, with options for quantity and (optionally) uniqueness when the range allows it.

Add shared, reusable frontend utility functions to support the Number & Conversion Tools calculations (percent math, date/time differences, base conversion, random number generation) in a new or existing lib module, and ensure consistent formatting and validation across tools.
